results.title: Bang the drum slowly. - Edited Version.
results.creator_credit: John Hancock, Lois Rosenfield and Maurice Rosenfield
results.brief_description: Edited version of the feature film based on Mark Harris’s classic story of friendship, compassion and death set against a background of major-league baseball. Robert de Niro stars as the baseball hero who discovers that he is dying of leukemia.

results.title: Banduk (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Di Drew, Penelope Spence and National Nine Network
results.brief_description: Banduk, a young Aboriginal girl, and her friends discover that the “friendly” proprietors of an ice-cream van are smuggling native animals, including the sacred red-collared parakeet, out of Australia. This delightful story was filmed on location in Arnhem Land.

results.title: Bandits [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Paula Weinstein, Michele Berk, Michael Birnbaum and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Escaping from prison in a cement truck, rugged ladies-man Joe (Bruce Willis) and neurotic hypochondriac Terry (Billy Bob Thornton), find themselves criminal celebrities when they come upon a new way of robbing banks - sleeping over at the house of their victims the night before the heist. With paradise firmly in mind - a nightclub in Acapulco - the affable robbers target bank managers, sleep over, then catch a ride into work before robbing it. Their modus operandi garners them the moniker of the “Sleepover bandits.” Trouble ensues when the men separate and make their own way to the rendezvous. Terry runs out of petrol and ends up being “kidnapped” by manic-depressive housewife Kate (Cate Blanchett), who accidentally hits him with her car. Eager to make it up to him and nonplussed at being removed from her loveless marriage, Kate calls herself a bandit too - but not before endearing herself to both men who fall in love with her. Told in flashback and presented as part of a tell all scoop on “Criminals at large”, “Bandits” also features Troy Garity as Joe’s cousin; getaway driver, wannabe stuntman and pursuer of a mystery female hitchhiker. A curious blend of comedy, action and road movie, “Bandits” was originally intended as an adaptation of the Elmore Leonard book of the same name. Instead, the script was completely rewritten by Harvey Peyton (Twin Peaks).

results.title: Bandit Queen
results.creator_credit: Shekhar Kapur, Sundeep S Bedi, Kaleidoscope and Film Four International
results.brief_description: This movie tells the “true story” of Phoolan Devi, the Indian bandit queen who was arrested in the state of Uttar Pradesh in 1983 for kidnapping and murder and was freed in 1994 because of a change in government. As a young girl she questioned the caste restrictions around her, is married at 13 but leaves the village and her marriage in search of independence. As a young woman she is captivated by Vikram, a bandit gang member. His gang kidnaps and rapes her, Vikram kills the leader and assumes leadership with Devi. Vikram is eventually killed in a dispute over leadership after SriRam returns from prison. Initially Devi is driven by seeking vengeance over the death of her lover, but after being gang raped by SriRam in her own village she is seeking revenge for herself. This culminates in the Behmai Massacre of February 1981. Cast includes Seema Biswas, Nirmal Pandey and Govind Namdeo.

results.title: Banaras: the holy city
results.creator_credit: K Khandpur, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Presents various facets of life in the ageless city of Banaras, also known as Varanasi or Benares. The origin of the city is not known. It has been a Hindu sacred city, the home of Shiva, Lord of the Universe, for centuries. Includes prayers and chants, ceremonies and acts of devotions in temples and on the holy river bank; traditional Hindu schools; the 200 year-old observatory, centre of astrology; Sanskrit education at the University of Banaras; traditions and cottage industries; the nearby shrine where Buddha preached his first sermon; Buddhist devotions around it.

results.title: Banaras: steps to heaven
results.brief_description: The most sacred of India’s cities, Banaras is the meeting place of heaven and earth. For over two-thousand five hundred years pilgrims have journeyed to Banaras to bathe in the River Ganges and to be cremated on its banks, and the film explores the spiritual forces that have ensured the survival of Banaras over thousands of years of history.

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: Wish fairies
results.creator_credit: Di Drew, Paul Faint, Tammy Burnstock, Virginia Lumsden and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: B1 and B2 dress up as Wish Fairies so that they can secretly make wishes come true for the Teddies. Meanwhile the Rat in the Hat discovers the fairies and schemes to catch them so he can sell the wishes in his shop. Includes five other Bananas in Pyjamas stories.
